channel.title: Comments on: SSIS Test yourself with these interview questions

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: TIL I don't know the first thing when it comes to SSIS... apparently
item.content:encoded: TIL I don’t know the first thing when it comes to SSIS… apparently

item.title: By: sqlsister
item.dc:creator: sqlsister
item.content:encoded:
One of my former coworkers got this question in an interview and it has become my favorite SSIS question to determine if the person has really used SSIS extensively:

Tell me what are the things that most annoy you when you are using SSIS.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: One that was very similar to that was in the original list. It's a very good question and one I think everyone should know. We just can't afford to be static when it comes to a daily routine of consuming external resources in SSIS :)
item.content:encoded: One that was very similar to that was in the original list. It’s a very good question and one I think everyone should know. We just can’t afford to be static when it comes to a daily routine of consuming external resources in SSIS ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
I would add to this list

How can you have SSIS pick up a connection where the filename changes everyday..for example ExelSheet_YYYYMMDD.xls
